title: Pep Guardiola bemoans nerves and wayward passing from Man City stars after Wolves defeat
text:
City are now eight points behind Liverpool in the title race (Picture: Getty)

Pep Guardiola blamed wayward passing and nerves for Manchester City’s defeat to Wolves on Sunday.

The loss leaves City eight points behind Premier League leaders Liverpool after just eight games.

Wolves brilliantly exploited a flat performance at the Etihad from the defending champions and Guardiola identified why his side were so off the pace.

‘It was a bad day, sometimes it happens,’ said Guardiola after the game.

Guardiola bemoaned nerves and wayward passing from his players (Picture: Getty)

‘We started quite well and after we conceded two situations in our buildup where it’s impossible to defend, we got a little bit nervous.

‘We controlled them better in the second half but at the end with us attacking and people up front, we lost balls in positions it is so difficult and they were clinical.

‘Before that we hit the post we had actions but the way we played was not good. It was not a good day, we didn’t play good.’

Adama Traore scored a second-half brace and it is the first time in 45 league games City have failed to find the back of the net at home.

Club action is now on hold for the international break (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool, on the other hand, tightened their grip on top spot with a dramatic win over Leicester City in their game on Saturday.

James Milner scored a last-minute penalty and club action now pauses for a two-week international break.
